result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D Zautner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:03pm [mo]
Defendant Benjamin D Zautner in court with Attorney Walter Piel.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance 
Atty. Piel verifies receipt of Pre-Sentence Investigation; no request for modifications
ADA Shock verifies receipt of Pre-Sentence Investigation; no request for modifications

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Zautner

On Counts #1 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1 to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence 4/10/15 at 7:00am; can be served at Dodge Co. so long as can be arranged by Sheriff's and does violate a DOC condition
--no possession of non prescribed drugs
--use of prescribed medication only with a valid prescription and only as directed by the prescribing physician
--no association with any known drug dealer or drug user,with the exception of treatment at the agent's discretion
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no contact with Felicia Busch
--to provide DNA sample upon demand
--On Count #1 to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Deptartment of Corrections

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
Felony firearms/voting prohibition warnings given
recess: 1:43pm
Sentencing hearing on March 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Conflict review worksheet
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case Called at 1:02pm [MO & MK]
Defendant Benjamin D Zautner in court with Attorney Walter Arthur Piel.    ADA Jeff Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Zautner. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed. The Court has no recollection of Mr. Zautner or the case. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "guilty" entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in Counts #2 and #4. On agreement of the parties, the Court orders a Pre- Sentence Investigation. 
Attorney Piel indicates that the defense is intending to have a private Pre- Sentencing Investigation report prepared also.
The Court confirms with Attorney Piel that he has recieved the Amended Information and waives reading; Mr. Zautner pleas made today were on the Amended Information.
Recess:  1:37p.m.

NEXT: (1) Pre-Sentence Investigation is ordered  (2)Sentencing Hearing on March 31, 2015 at 1:00pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
AMENDED

case called at 3:40pm. [MK]
Defendant Benjamin D Zautner in court with Attorney Walter A Piel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial on December 18th.
Attorney Piel indicates that the Motion to Amend the Information is not opposed. 
The Court grants the Motion, and amends the Information to replace the term "syringe" with the term "spoon". 
Attorney Piel requests that the case be set for Plea and Sentencing in approximately thirty days, explaining that Mr. Zautner was placed on programming under a Deferred Prosecution Agreement in Dodge County last week, and also providing the Court the assurance that Mr. Zautner is also being monitored by WCS in Waukesha.  
The Court informs the parties that this case will transfer to Branch III/Judge Wambach on January 1st. 
Mr. Zautner verifies that the Davis Street, Watertown address is current.  
recess 3:45pm. 

NEXT:  case is referred to Branch III for scheduling, with the information that the Defense has indicated that they will be prepared to proceed to plea/sentencing in approximately 30 days

State does not object to request to reschedule

case called at 2:20pm. [MK]
Defendant Benjamin D Zautner in court with Attorney Walter A Piel.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

--pleas of "not guilty" entered

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/29/14 at 11:00am,  (2) schedule Status Conference on November 17th or a date shortly thereafter
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Court grants request to reschedule
from State re: Def. Counsel request to reschedule Preliminary Hearing-I do not object - ADA Shock
from Def. Counsel re: request to reschedule Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Amended Bond, as ordered by the Court on August 4th, 2014.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:37am. 
Attorney Walter Piel in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case was scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Attorney Piel indicates that Defendant Benjamin Zautner does not appear because he has an 11:00 appointment this morning to be admitted into the Herrington Inpatient Treatment Program at Rogers Memorial Hospital.  This plan was created as part of Mr. Zautner's parents posting cash bail in a new Waukesha County possession of controlled substances case last week. 
Attorney Piel does not have information on the length of the in-treatment programming, but assumes it will be 45 to 60 days in length. 
A telephone call is placed to Mr Zautner's father, Kent Zautner and the Court confirms with Kent Zautner that he is taking Benjamin Zautner to the Rogers Hospital for the 11:00 appointment this morning.  The Court then rings off the telephone call. 
The Court and counsel discuss the State's concern that this programming is not in a locked facility and Mr. Zautner will have the ability to walk out of the program. 
The Court indicates that it will reschedule the Preliminary Hearing. 
The Court directs Attorney Piel to notify the Court if Benjamin Zautner leaves the facility, or if the programming is going to be shorter than the anticipated 45 days. 
On Motion of the State, the Court modifies the bond to add a condition that Mr. Zautner is:  to participate in the Herrington Inpatient Treatment Program at Rogers Hospital in Oconomowoc until he is succesfully discharged from the program.  Attorney Piel is to arrange with Mr. Zautner and his parents that he come sign the bond yet this morning before he is admitted into the program.
recess 8:46am. 

NEXT:  reschedule Preliminary Hearing in approximately 45 days
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
